messages.subject: mini-conferences
messages.msgSnippet: Message: 8 Date: Mon, 27 Sep 2004 23:58:40 EDT From: AtticOfThought@aol.com Subject: Re: mini-conferences I have to make this e-mail quick, I heard talk of
messages.messageBody:
Message: 8
Date: Mon, 27 Sep 2004 23:58:40 EDT
From: AtticOfThought@...
Subject: Re: mini-conferences

I have to make this e-mail quick,
I heard talk of trying to get a mini convention going around the DC
area, I'm
a new home schooler, and really dont know much about the people or
events
around here, but i live in Fredericksburg witch is close, if theres any
thing i
can do to help just let me know
~liz

Hi Liz - I'm right in your local area. I just sent you a message
off-list about meeting up if you'd like and the VHEA Conference that was
in the Science Museum of Virginia in Richmond. It's not an unschooling
conference per se, but I consider it to be unschooler-friendly. VHEA is
an inclusive group that focuses strictly on homeschooling issues and is
not tied to any religious or political philosophy. www.vhea.org
<http://www.vhea.org/>

TTFN!

~ Alicia



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] mini-conferences
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/19/2004 7:34:26 AM Eastern Daylight Time, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes: THEN, I would wave another wand to have
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/19/2004 7:34:26 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:
THEN, I would wave another wand to have mini-conferences show up all over
the US in the spring, as a kind of shot in the arm half-way through the
year.
Pam Genant has pulled together a min-conference in Nov in NC----the kind I'm
Being the recovering controller that I am, and not wanting to wait until 2054
to have a conference here, I'm planning a one day mini-conf in the DC area
for the late spring. Probably in Silver Spring, maybe closer to my home in WV.
It's a beautiful crunchy area here.

Elissa Jill

Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you;
They're supposed to help you discover who you are.
~Bernice Johnson Reagon
